pageContext.claim: “Buying this equipment for very expensive. But we haven't been able -- it's true. We haven't been able to match the dog. I've seen out at Secret Service, where they showed me the dogs, certain types of German Shepherd -- very specific types of dog.”
pageContext.analysis: According to a 2014 study, German shepherds are the most effective dogs at detecting illegal drugs overall. However, all K9 unit effectiveness fell when searching vehicles and they had the most difficulty detecting opioids. New technology employed by the Customs and Border Protection can detect over 14,000 chemical substances from outside of packages, allowing for more immediate detection.
